Let's say self.early_exit[1] == 2 and layers_msk is not None, the input will go through the first 2 layers of self.layers_msk without sharing the modules of the fisrt 2 layers self.layers. refer to the code: fairseq/models/nat/levenshtein_transformer.py, <denchmark-code> # in extract_features(self, prev_output_tokens, encoder_out=None, early_exit=None, layers=None, **unused) # input will go through the first early_exit layer's if layers is not None for _, layer in enumerate(layers[: early_exit]): x, attn, _ = layer( x, encoder_out.encoder_out if encoder_out is not None else None, encoder_out.encoder_padding_mask if encoder_out is not None else None, self_attn_mask=None, self_attn_padding_mask=decoder_padding_mask, ) inner_states.append(x)
# but here, if self.early_exit[1] == 2 and layers_msk is not None, the input will not go through the first 2 layers of self.layers. def forward_mask_ins(self, normalize, encoder_out, prev_output_tokens, **unused): features, extra = self.extract_features( prev_output_tokens, encoder_out=encoder_out, early_exit=self.early_exit[1], layers=self.layers_msk, **unused ) </denchmark-code>
